oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Control of diffusion of nano-particles in an optical vortex lattice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zapata, Ivar
Delgado-Buscalioni, Rafael
Sáenz, Juan José
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics
Condensed Matter - Statistical Mechanics
Physics - Optics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A two-dimensional periodic optical force field, which combines conservative dipolar forces with vortices from radiation pressure, is proposed in order to influence the diffusion properties of optically susceptible nano-particles. The different deterministic flow patterns are identified. In the low noise limit, the diffusion coefficient is computed from a Mean First Passage Time (MFPT) and the Most Probable Escape Paths (MPEP) are identified for those flow patterns which possess an stable stationary point. Numerical simulations of the associated Langevin equations show remarkable agreement with the analytically deduced expressions. Modifications of the force field are proposed so that a wider range of phenomena could be tested.
